meanings.sent1: The lawyer decided to prosecute the criminal for stealing.
meanings.sent2: The district attorney will prosecute the case in court next week.
meanings.sent3: Why did the police officer prosecute the mischievous squirrel for nut theft?
meanings.sent4: The prosecutor will diligently prosecute the case to ensure justice is served.
meanings.sent5: The decision to prosecute the suspect was met with mixed reactions from the community.

meanings.definition: Continue with (a course of action) with a view to its completion
meanings.sent1: Despite the challenges, she will prosecute her plan to start a small business.
meanings.sent2: The team will prosecute their strategy to win the championship.
meanings.sent3: He decided to prosecute his goal of learning a new language by practicing every day.
meanings.sent4: She will prosecute her dream of traveling the world by saving money diligently.
meanings.sent5: The company will prosecute their mission to provide quality products to customers.
